question: Posted By John W. on November 28, 1998 at 19:21:01:I have experienced numbness in both larger toes that has been described as peripheral neuoropathy but I lack the more obvious occupational exposures, diabetes or alcohol consumption issues that would provide an explanation for what has caused this.  I am concerned about its progression and about what other causative agents might exist.Poor circulation has been ruled out as a cause.Has caffeine consumption been implicated as a cause?Are there other compounds to look out for?
title: peripheral neuropathy
